intro: Ruellia intrusa, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially sunny environments. Ruellia intrusa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
